summary: Hurricane Andrew was a powerful storm that hit the Bahamas, Florida, and Louisiana in August 1992. It was the worst hurricane to affect Florida, destroying over 63,500 houses and causing $27.3 billion in damage. Andrew started as a tropical depression in the Atlantic Ocean and intensified into a Category 5 hurricane. It made landfall in Florida with strong winds and caused major damage in cities like Homestead and Cutler Bay. The storm also affected the Bahamas and Louisiana, damaging oil platforms and causing flooding. In total, 65 people died due to Andrew.
title: Hurricane Andrew
